page.title: 07Historic Buildings, Ceres
page.content:
{ St John's Masonic Lodge }was built in 1765. It looks over Ceres Burn and Bishop's Bridge. It was allowed to deteriorate but because of its beauty and position in the village, Central and North Fife Preservation Society, working together with the National Trust for Scotland, purchased the building and its grounds and carried out renovations in 1964. It is now used as a dwelling house.
{ Bishop's Bridge}was so named because Archbishop Sharp crossed over it just before being brutally killed on Magus Moor by Covenanters in 1679. The 17th century bridge enhances the beauty of this part of the villge and serves now as a means of reaching the High Street from the recently improved car park.
